intro: Sommea, commonly known as the dwarf hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant features showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to deep red. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs. Sommea thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth.
